intro: Aconogonon savatieri var. iturupense, commonly known as the Iturup morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant produces trumpet-shaped blooms that open in the morning and close by midday. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
